title: 18th century san serif?
content:
In the research I have done, it appears as though there wasn’t really a san serif typeface introduced until 1820 or so but, is anyone familiar with an 18th century predecessor? I am working on a project that needs a typeface that initialized in the 18th century.

-gl

 [‹ Death By Bodoni](http://web.archive.org/web/20081019125159/http:/typophile.com/node/50332 "Go to previous forum topic") [DAS KAPITAL ›](http://web.archive.org/web/20081019125159/http:/typophile.com/node/50545 "Go to next forum topic")
author: gl

comments.content: [Sebastian](http://web.archive.org/web/20081019125159/http:/www.stormtype.com/typefaces-fonts-shop/families-42-sebastian) is a good historical fiction of what an 18th century sans might have looked like.
